alert.note: Alert for Covington; Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 1:16PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Crenshaw and central Covington Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 116 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Andalusia, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Andalusia, Opp and Heath. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
